site.title: One Breath Partnership
site.description: One Breath Partnership elevates the work for clean air, every day, in Houston, Harris County and our region.

mainImage.alt: Houston's communities of color and lower wealth have often been forced to live in harm's way. Photo: Julie Demansky.
mainImage.caption: Houston's communities of color and lower wealth have often been forced to live in harm's way. Photo: Julie Demansky.

node.title: Houstonians don't have to live with pollution

children.text: We don’t have to accept that, when it comes to chemical disasters and industrial pollution in our communities, that whatever happens, happens.

node.Action1Title: Watch Air Alliance Houston's Dr. Bakeyah Nelson urge Congress to hold polluters accountable

mainImage.alt: Between 2009 and 2017, TCEQ fined gas station operators nearly as much as industrial polluters. Photo: Pixnio.
mainImage.caption: Between 2009 and 2017, TCEQ fined gas station operators nearly as much as industrial polluters. Photo: Pixnio.

node.title: TCEQ makes many questionable decisions. Here are some of the worst.

children.text: Texans deserve better from the agency charged with protecting our health and environment.

node.Action1Title: Join hundreds of Texans and sign the petition to #CleanUpTCEQ

mainImage.alt: Wally the Wise Guy teaches young people how to shelter in place during chemical disasters, such as the March 2019 fire at Intercontinental Terminals Company in Deer Park, Texas.
mainImage.caption: Wally the Wise Guy teaches young people how to shelter in place during chemical disasters, such as the March 2019 fire at Intercontinental Terminals Company in Deer Park, Texas.

node.title: The face of the petrochemical industry's recklessness

children.text: Like other safety mascots, Wally Wise Guy stands in for real solutions to protecting our health and preventing chemical disasters, showing us only how to live with them until they're over.

node.Action1Title: Learn more about Gov. Greg Abbott's history of siding with industry

mainImage.alt: A plant exploded at Exxon Mobil complex in Baytown in July 2019. Photo: Kathleen Thompson.
mainImage.caption: A plant exploded at Exxon Mobil complex in Baytown in July 2019. Photo: Kathleen Thompson.

node.title: 86th Texas Legislature punts on Houston chemical fires

children.text: If you’re wondering what the 86th Texas Legislature did to help prevent dangerous and persistent fires in the petrochemical corridor near Houston this year, the answer – unfortunately – is not much.

node.Action1Title: See how the chemical fires affected one Houston-area student

mainImage.alt: The City of Houston mounted air monitors on municipal vehicles to test drive new ways to collect data. Photo: Marie De Jesus.
mainImage.caption: The City of Houston mounted air monitors on municipal vehicles to test drive new ways to collect data. Photo: Marie De Jesus.

node.title: Air Alliance Houston’s Bakeyah Nelson to Congress: “EPA and TCEQ are not holding the polluters accountable”

children.text: Dr. Nelson underlined the critical role of enforcement to protect communities of color and low wealth as hazardous facilities are disproportionately concentrated in these neighborhoods.

node.Action1Title: Let Gov. Abbott know we need to #CleanUpTCEQ

mainImage.alt: After the heavy rains hit Houston, eight area plants shut down, triggering a dangerous pulse of 1.3 million pounds of unpermitted air pollution. Photo: Karl Spencer.
mainImage.caption: After the heavy rains hit Houston, eight area plants shut down, triggering a dangerous pulse of 1.3 million pounds of unpermitted air pollution. Photo: Karl Spencer.

node.title: Industry’s delay worsened air pollution during Hurricane Harvey

children.text: In the Houston region, industries waited for more than three days until heavy rains started falling before taking action to shut down, and then suffered larger pollution releases because of flooding and blackouts.

node.Action1Title: Read the Houston Chronicle's editorial about the suspension of environmental regulations after Imelda

mainImage.alt: One Breath Partnership in the media.

node.title: Imelda cited in release of almost 100,000 pounds of air pollutants

children.text: As Imelda dumped as many as 43 inches of rain across the Houston region, leading to what the Houston Chronicle reported as "unauthorized releases [of chemicals] ... triggered by electrical outages, the failure of floating roof tanks and equipment malfunctions caused by flooding," companies reported "nearly 100,000 pounds of toxins, including cancer-causing 1,3 butadiene, benzene and ethylene oxide" entering our air.

node.Action1Title: Share this story on Twitter with the hashtag #OurSharedHou

mainImage.alt: One Breath Partnership in the media.

node.title: New TCEQ commissioner an Abbott aid with nuclear waste experience

children.text: Gov. Greg Abbott appointed Bobby Janecka as the third commissioner to the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality.

node.Action1Title: See some of about TCEQ's industry-friendly decisions

mainImage.alt: One Breath Partnership in the media.

node.title: Environmental racism is real, and presidential candidates must show how they’ll address it

children.text: Presidential candidates must explain how they will move our nation, our shared home, to an economy with 100 percent clean energy while creating jobs and protecting the most vulnerable from the brunt of devastating health and economic impacts.

mainImage.alt: One Breath Partnership in the media.

node.title: Texas regulators may raise the acceptable level of a toxic chemical

children.text: TCEQ is considering raising the acceptable threshold of levels of ethylene oxide, a gas the EPA found in 2016 that is much more carcinogenic than once thought.

mainImage.alt: One Breath Partnership in the media.

node.title: It's not enough to sue polluters after chemical fires. We need to enforce the laws we have.

children.text: Texas has not made before-the-fact enforcement a strong goal, often doing the bare minimum allowed under federal law.

node.Action1Title: See some of TCEQ's worst decisions
